newsitem.title: RUSSIA: LUKoil mulling prefs issue, but not for 1997.
newsitem.headline: LUKoil mulling prefs issue, but not for 1997.

text.p: Russia's largest oil producer LUKoil has plans to issue new preferred shares but will not make the move in 1997, the head of its securities division said on Thursday.
"In the future we will look at a preferred share," LUKoil Vice President Leonid Fedun told Reuters in an interview.
"One variation is a preferred share convertible to ordinary shares," he said.

"I do not think there will be any (new) issues this year aside from the global issue," he added, referring to plans to issue level-three American Depositary Receipts representing 15 percent of LUKoil shares held by the government towards the end of the year.
But Fedun said that LUKoil might issue new prefs this year in order to pay for acquisitions. "There might be one exception -- if LUKoil acquires some structures in Russia."
Earlier OAO Neftyanaya Kompaniya LUKoil said it had received approval from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to issue ADRs on its existing preferred shares.
At 1445 LUKoil prefs were $13.10, up from Thursday's closing $11.75 and ordinaries were $15.30, up from $15.10.
